result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:02 AM cases 21CF1006, 22CF594 called. Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney George E. Miller appeared by video for Scott M. Vaningan. Defendant Scott M. Vaningan appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional Facility. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. 

In 22CF594 Defendant waives right to a Preliminary Hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Plea hearing set for both cases on 12/02/2022 at 9:45 AM via Zoom.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cases called at 4:02 PM: 21CF1006, 22CF594.
Defendant Scott M. Vaningan appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Scott M. Vaningan.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to personal appearance. Attorney Miller requests the matter be adjourned until December as the Defendant as charges in Chippewa that will effect this case.
STC: 10/31/22 at 9:00 AM (Via Zoom).
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(Cases 21CF1006, 22CF594 are called at 4:13 PM) Defendant Scott M. Vaningan in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Scott M. Vaningan. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Informations in both cases. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Defense intends to file motions- requests to schedule Status Conference. State requests to schedule a motion hearing after the motion is filed. Court indicates once any motions are filed a hearing can be scheduled and the Status can be removed. 
Status Conference: 08/15/2022 at 4:00 PM (IN PERSON).
